text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm hello English learners welcome back
to daily video vocabulary episode 9
today's new phrases may I take your
let's find out what it means and how to
use this phrase in your daily
conversation may I take your so what it
means let's take an example may I take
your name or what is your name which one
is correct well both sentences are
correct but may I take your name sounds
more polite and formal so may I take
your means more polite or formal way of
asking for something may is also used in
asking and giving permissions now if you
said what is your name is correct when
you are writing somebody's name but it's
not really polite or formal in a
business situation you can use this
phrase when you are going to write down
the person's name or other details well
if you meet somebody on the street or at
a restaurant
you wouldn't say may I take your name
this phrase is more applicable in office
setting
or a customer service department where
the operator has to write down the
details of Augusta it sounds more formal
now let's look at some example sentences
those you hear when you call the
customer service department
example one you called a computer
service company and want to speak to
John and hardware engineer to explain
your problem
the receptionist would say may I take
your name please she means she wants to
make a note of your name example two in
continuation to your conversation with
the receptionist she tells you that John
isn't there at his desk she will take
down your phone number and ask John to
call you back listen how she will say
John isn't there at his desk may I take
your phone number and ask John to call
you back later example three your
computer is with the computer company
for repairs and you want to use your
neighbor's computer how will you ask for
the same in a polite way my computer is
under repair may I use your computer
until next Monday yes you may
